info.name: Sales and Commerce Scenarios
info.description:
SAP Business ByDesign API Samples - Sales and Commerce Scenarios
================================================================

This Postman collection contains examples to create, change and read business objects and to run end-to-end business processes using *SAP Business ByDesign Custom OData Services*.
Each collection folder corresponds to a business scenario; execute the web service requests in the listed order within each folder.

All sample data is aligned to and ready to run on *SAP Business ByDesign Partner Demo Tenants (Full scope US)* with preconfigured and loaded sample data provided by SAP.  
  


**Web services and User:**

The OData services used in this collection require a SAP ByDesign business user for authorization.  
  

SAP ByDesign business objects provide defaulting capabilities based on the organizational assignment of the user logged in. In many sample OData requests I use this defaulting to keep the OData requests simple.  
Therefore, assign the employee or service agent that is associated to your business user to the organizational unit *A1100* and job *System Administrator* to ensure proper defaulting based on your organizational assignment.  
  

The OData requests in this collection use the following SAP Bydesign *Custom OData Services* assigned to the work center views in column *User authorization*. Assign the listed SAP ByDesign Work Center Views to your business user:

| Custom OData Service | User authorization (ByD Work Center View) |  
|----------------------|-------------------------------------------|  
| *khsalesorder* | *Sales Orders - Sales Orders* |  
| *khcustomerinvoicerequest* | *Customer Invoicing - Invoice Requests* |  
| *khcustomerinvoice* | *Customer Invoicing - Invoice Documents* |  
| *khcustomerreturn* | *Sales Orders - Returns* |
| *khoutbounddeliveryrequest* | *Outbound Logistics - Delivery Proposals* |  
| *khoutbounddelivery* | *Outbound Logistics - Outbound Deliveries* |  
| *khinbounddelivery* | *Inbound Logistics - Inbound Delivery Notifications* |
| *khconfirmedinbounddelivery* | *Inbound Logistics - Inbound Deliveries* |
| *khhousebankaccount* | *Liquidity Management - My Banks* |
| *khcompanypaymentfileregister* | *Liquidity Management - Inbound Files* |
| *khhousebankstatement* | *Liquidity Management - Bank Statements* |
| *khpayment* | *Payment Management - Payment Monitor* |
| *khpaymentorderprocessingstatement* | *Payment Management - Clearing House Statements* |

  

Additionally this collection uses the SOAP Web Service APIs:  
- *Manage Sales Orders* (required because external payment information cannot be created using OData)
- *Manage Customer Invoice Requests* (required because external payment information cannot be created using OData)  

Steps to configure SOAP the Web Service APIs:
1. Work center view *Application and User Management - Communication Systems*: Create a communication system
2. Work center view *Application and User Management - Communication Scenarios*: Create a communication scenario with web service APIs listed above
3. Work center view *Application and User Management - Communication Arrangements*: Create communication arrangement for your scenario of step 2, the communication system of step 1 and enter the credentials  
  


**Business Configuration:**  

The following fine tuning settings are required additionally to the preconfigured and loaded sample data provided by the SAP Business ByDesign Partner Demo Tenant.  
  

Configure the determination methode for external references:  
ByD work center *Business Configuration*: Open the fine tuning activity *External Reference Number Determination for Customer Invoice* and set the determination method to *Copied from Predecessor Reference ID*.  
  

Create company payment file register:  
Open work center view *Liquidity Management - Inbound Files*, click on *New* > *Inbound File* and enter the following values:  
	*Type: Bank Statement* | *Company: 1000* | *Bank ID: 1000002* | *Import Format: BAI2 US*.  
Save without adding an attachment.  
The system created a company payment file register for company 1000 that can now be used for file uploads via OData.  
  

The bank statements created in this collection are automatically allocated if you apply the following fine tuning settings:  
1. Fine-Tuning activity *Automatically Generated Bank Statements* > *Assign import formats for bank statements*:  
Add row using the values: *Company ID: 1000* | *Bank ID: 1000002* | *Bank Statement Format: 02 - BAI2 US*
2. Fine-Tuning activity *Settings for Posting Automatically Generated Bank Statements*:  
Add row using the values: Seq.: 1 | Company: 1000 | Bank Country: * | Bank ID: * | Currency: * | Bank Account ID: * | Manual Post Necessary: False
3. Fine-Tuning activity *Global Settings for Payment* > *Create and edit rules for analyzing memo lines*:  
Add a rules: 
	- Rule 1: *Description: Customer Return External Reference* | *Rule Type: 13* | *Rule Definition Mode: Expert* | *Regular Expression: (E-CRN-\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{4}\d{1,2}\d{1,2}\d{2}\d{2}\d{2})*
	- Rule 2: *Description: Sales Order External Payment* | *Rule Type: 14* | *Rule Definition Mode: Expert* | *Regular Expression: (E-PAYTAREF-\d{4}\d{1,2}\d{1,2}\d{2}\d{2}\d{2})*
4. Fine-Tuning activity *Automatically Generated Bank Statements* > *Edit import formats for automatic generated bank statements*:
Add two rows to Import Format "02 - BAI2 US":
	- Transaction code assignment 1: *External Transaction Code: 399* | *Description: Miscellaneous Credit* | *Debit/Credit: Increase* | *Payment Method: Payment Processing - Of Incoming External Payment*
	- Transaction code assignment 2: *External Transaction Code: 699* | *Description: Miscellaneous Debit* | *Debit/Credit: Decrease* | *Payment Method: Payment Processing - Of Outgoing Direct Debit*  

	Remark: Basically you can use any external transaction codes, you just have to make sure that the transaction codes match the codes used to create the bank statement file. The setting of transaction code assignment 2 is required to trigger the automated allocation of the bank statement line item to the credit memo open item related to customer returns (customer returns do not yet result in payments in transfer, but remain open items).  
  

**New Payment Register/Payment Monitor:**  

OData access to the SAP ByDesign *Payment Monitor* (business object *PaymentRegister*) requires to activate the new high-performance payment register/payment monitor.  

You can check if the new payment monitor is already active in your system by sending the following request:  
Postman collection *Sales and Commerce Scenarios* > folder *Miscellaneous Samples* > request *Get payments (new payment monitor)*.  
The OData service request retrieves all payment register entries of the last 30 days; if the OData service response is empty and you see some entries in the payment monitor in ByD work center view *Payment Management - Payment Monitor*, then the new payment register is not active in your system.  

You can request to activate the new payment register by creating an SAP ByDesign incident.  
  


**Additional Information:**  
The sales order origin type (*DataOriginTypeCode*) can be used integrate webshops with ByD. Relevant code values for the examples in collection are *1 - Manual data entry* and *4 - Internet order (webshop integration)*.  
Compare blog post [Create ByD Sales Orders using Web Services](https://blogs.sap.com/2017/08/10/create-byd-sales-orders-using-web-services/) for more details.  
  


Scenario 1a: eCommerce - Sell from stock with external payment
--------------------------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:
1. Create and release sales order with external payment information (SOAP Web Service API)
2. Get and check delivery proposal (Business object *OutboundDeliveryRequest*)
3. Post goods issue
4. Get, check and release outbound delivery (Business object *OutboundDelivery*)
5. Get, check and release the customer invoice request
6. Get, check and release customer invoice
7. Check sales order status

If the availability check fails, you can fill up your stock using Postman collection **End-to-End Scenarios** and scenario **Procure to Stock**.  

Payments in transfer created by this scenario can be confirmed using scenario **eCommerce - Confirm payments using bank statements**.  
  


Scenario 1b: eCommerce - Customer return to stock
-------------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:
1. Get and check the sales order and outbound delivery from scenario *eCommerce - Sell from stock with external payment*
2. Create customer return notification (Business object *InboundDelivery*)
3. Post goods receipt and check the confirmed inbound delivery (Business object *ConfirmedInboundDelivery*)
4. Get and release the customer return
5. Get the customer invoice request (credit memo) and update the payment reference (needed to allocate the bank statement line item)
6. Get and release the customer credit memo
7. Check the status of the customer return

Open items created by this scenario can be cleared using scenario **eCommerce - Confirm payments using bank statements**.  
  


Scenario 1c: eCommerce - Confirm payments using bank statements
---------------------------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:
1. Read previous bank statement to get the last closing balance (Business object *HouseBankStatement*)
2. Get open items to be cleared and create BAI2 bank statement file
	- Get the customer invoice from scenario *eCommerce - Sell from stock with external payment* and the credit memo of scenario *eCommerce - Customer return to stock* and create a suitable bank statement file
	- Use the closing balance of step 1 as opening balance of the bank statement file
3. Get company house bank account (Business object *HouseBankAccount*)
4. Get company payment file register (Business object *CompanyPaymentFileRegister*)
5. Create incoming file using the file of step 2 (Business object *CompanyPaymentFileRegister*)
6. Trigger file upload (Alternatively start the file upload via ByD work center view *Liquidity Management - Inbound Files*) 

  


Scenario 2a: Invoice External Billing Documents - Customer invoice with external payment
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:
1. Create and release external customer invoice with external payment information (SOAP Web Service API)
2. Get and check the customer invoice request
3. Get and check the customer invoice

Payments in transfer created by this scenario can be pre-confirmed using scenario **Invoice External Billing Documents - Pre-confirm payments using clearing house statements** and finally confirmed using scenario **Invoice External Billing Documents - Confirm payments using bank statements**.  
  


Scenario 2b: Invoice External Billing Documents - Pre-confirm payments using clearing house statements
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:
1. Get customer invoice (payments in transfer) and create clearing house statement file (Get the customer invoice from scenario *Invoice External Billing Documents - Customer invoice with external payment* and create a suitable clearing house statement file).  
Alternative in scenario **Invoice External Billing Documents - Pre-confirm payments using clearing house statements**: Get payments in transfer from the payment monitor (Business object *Payment*) and create clearing house statement file.
2. Get company payment file register (Business object *CompanyPaymentFileRegister*)
3. Create incoming file using the file of step 1 (Business object *CompanyPaymentFileRegister*)
4. Trigger file upload (Alternatively start the file upload via ByD work center view *Liquidity Management - Inbound Files*) 
5. Check file upload status

Payments pre-confirmed by this scenario can be confirmed using scenario **Invoice External Billing Documents - Confirm payments using bank statements**.  
  


Scenario 2c: Invoice External Billing Documents - Confirm payments using bank statements
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:
1. Read previous bank statement to get the last closing balance (Business object *HouseBankStatement*)
2. Get open items to be cleared and create BAI2 bank statement file
	- Get the clearing house statement from scenario *Invoice External Billing Documents - Pre-confirm payments using clearing house statements* and create a suitable bank statement file
	- Use the closing balance of step 1 as opening balance of the bank statement file
3. Get company house bank account (Business object *HouseBankAccount*)
4. Get company payment file register (Business object *CompanyPaymentFileRegister*)
5. Create incoming file using the file of step 2 (Business object *CompanyPaymentFileRegister*)
6. Trigger file upload (Alternatively start the file upload via ByD work center view *Liquidity Management - Inbound Files*) 
7. ByD UI: Open work center view *Liquidity Management - Bank Statements*, select the bank statement created in step 6, click on *Required* in column *Postprocessing*, select *Actions* > *Import clearing house statement* and select the clearing house statement selected in step 2. Check and post the allocation.

  


Scenario 3: Create Sales Order (nested create)
----------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:  
1. Create an internet sales order (sales order) with service item
2. Get and check the sales order
3. Release the customer request (submit the internet order)
4. Release the sales order
5. Get and check the sales order

  


Scenario 4: Create Sales Order using batch
------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:  
1. Create 2 sales orders and get the sales order data in one batch request

  


Scenario 5: Create Sales Order node by node
-------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:  
1. Create sales order
2. Add sales unit
3. Add account (buyer party)
4. Update pricing terms
5. Create an sales order item
6. Update the item product
7. Update item quantity (item schedule line)
8. Release the customer request (submit the internet order)
9. Get and check the sales order

  


Scenario 6: Create Sales Order with Attachments
-----------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:  
1. Create a sales order with attachments on header and item level
2. Get the sales order
3. Get the item attachment
4. Delete the item attachment
5. Add a new item attachment

Remark:  
The attachment binaries are Base64-encodes files (here: base64-encoded images of a document icon, icecream and shoes).

  


Scenario 7: Create Sales Order with price components (net)
----------------------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:  
1. Create sales order with net pricing
2. Get sales order with item price components
3. Update item tax code
4. Create custom list price for item 10
5. Create further item price components: product discount, surcharge, surcharge (%)
6. Get sales order with header price components
7. Create header price components: overall discount, freight surcharge, surcharge

  


Scenario 8: Create Sales Order with price components (gross)
------------------------------------------------------------

Scenario steps:  
1. Create sales order with gross pricing
2. Get sales order with item price components
3. Update item tax code
4. Create custom gross list price for item 10
5. Create further item gross price components: product discount, surcharge, surcharge (%)
6. Get sales order with header price components
7. Create header gross price components: overall discount, freight surcharge, surcharge

  


Scenario 9: Miscellaneous Samples
---------------------------------

Scenario steps:  
1. Get metadata
2. Get codelist for currency codes
3. Get code list for item processing type codes
2. Get sales orders using filter parameters
2. Get sales orders using search parameters
3. Get sales orders using a sales order query function import
4. Get payments (new payment monitor)

item.name: Sell from stock with external payment

exec: pm.test("Cross site request forgery token: received", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200); pm.response.to.have.header("x-csrf-token") });

item.name: Create sales order with external payment (SOAP 1.1)

exec: // Set Requested Fulfillment Period (Requested Date): today + 8 days

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:glob="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global" xmlns:glob1="http://sap.com/xi/AP/Globalization">
    <soapenv:Header/>
    <soapenv:Body>
        <glob:SalesOrderBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
            <BasicMessageHeader>
            	<!-- Enter message header UUID for idem potency! -->
                <!-- <UUID>?</UUID> -->
            </BasicMessageHeader>
            <SalesOrder actionCode="01">
                <ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>S1</ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>
                <ChangeStateID></ChangeStateID>
                <BuyerID>{{SalesOrderExternalReference}}</BuyerID>
                <Name>Internet Order {{SalesOrderExternalReference}}</Name>
                <!-- DataOriginTypeCode: 4 = Internet order -->
                <DataOriginTypeCode>4</DataOriginTypeCode>
                <ReleaseCustomerRequest>true</ReleaseCustomerRequest>
                <ReleaseAllItemsToExecution>true</ReleaseAllItemsToExecution>
                <SalesUnitParty actionCode="04">
                    <PartyID>{{SalesUnitID}}</PartyID>
                </SalesUnitParty>
                <SalesAndServiceBusinessArea actionCode="04">
                    <DistributionChannelCode>{{DistributionChannelCode}}</DistributionChannelCode>
                </SalesAndServiceBusinessArea>
                <AccountParty actionCode="04">
                    <PartyID>{{CustomerID}}</PartyID>
                </AccountParty>
                <RequestedFulfillmentPeriodPeriodTerms actionCode="04">
                    <StartDateTime timeZoneCode="UTC">{{RequestedFulfillmentStartDate}}</StartDateTime>
                    <EndDateTime timeZoneCode="UTC">{{RequestedFulfillmentEndDate}}</EndDateTime>
                </RequestedFulfillmentPeriodPeriodTerms>
            	<DeliveryTerms actionCode="04">
            		<DeliveryPriorityCode>1</DeliveryPriorityCode>
					<!--<Incoterms>
                		<ClassificationCode>?</ClassificationCode>
                		<TransferLocationName>?</TransferLocationName>
            		</Incoterms>
            		<PartialDeliveryControlCode>?</PartialDeliveryControlCode>
            		<CompleteDeliveryRequestedIndicator>?</CompleteDeliveryRequestedIndicator> -->
            	</DeliveryTerms>
                <PricingTerms actionCode="04">
                    <CurrencyCode>USD</CurrencyCode>
                    <PriceDateTime timeZoneCode="UTC">{{PriceDateTime}}</PriceDateTime>
                    <GrossAmountIndicator>true</GrossAmountIndicator>
                </PricingTerms>
                <PaymentControl actionCode="01">
                    <PaymentProcessingCompanyID>{{CompanyID}}</PaymentProcessingCompanyID>
                    <PaymentProcessingBusinessPartnerID>{{CustomerID}}</PaymentProcessingBusinessPartnerID>
                    <PropertyMovementDirectionCode>2</PropertyMovementDirectionCode>
                    <!-- PaymentFormCode: 20 = External Payment -->
                    <PaymentFormCode>20</PaymentFormCode>
                    <PaymentReferenceID>{{SalesOrderPaymentReferenceID}}</PaymentReferenceID>
                    <PaymentReferenceTypeCode>5</PaymentReferenceTypeCode>
                    <ExternalPayment actionCode="01">
                        <HouseBankAccountKeyInternalID>{{HouseBankAccountID}}</HouseBankAccountKeyInternalID>
                        <PaymentTransactionReferenceID>{{SalesOrderPaymentTransactionReferenceID}}</PaymentTransactionReferenceID>
                        <DocumentDate>{{DocumentDate}}</DocumentDate>
                        <ValueDate>{{ValueDate}}</ValueDate>
                        <Amount currencyCode="USD">2250.00</Amount>
                    </ExternalPayment>
                </PaymentControl>
                <Item actionCode="01">
                    <ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>S1-I1</ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>
                    <ID>10</ID>
                    <ProcessingTypeCode>TAN</ProcessingTypeCode>
                    <ItemProduct actionCode="04">
                        <ProductInternalID>{{MaterialID}}</ProductInternalID>
                    </ItemProduct>
                    <ItemScheduleLine actionCode="04">
                        <ID>1</ID>
                        <TypeCode>1</TypeCode>
                        <Quantity unitCode="EA">3</Quantity>
                    </ItemScheduleLine>
                    <PriceAndTaxCalculationItem actionCode="04">
                        <ItemMainPrice actionCode="04">
                            <Rate>
                                <DecimalValue>750.00</DecimalValue>
                                <CurrencyCode>USD</CurrencyCode>
                                <BaseDecimalValue>1</BaseDecimalValue>
                                <BaseMeasureUnitCode>EA</BaseMeasureUnitCode>
                            </Rate>
                        </ItemMainPrice>
                    </PriceAndTaxCalculationItem>
                </Item>
            </SalesOrder>
        </glob:SalesOrderBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
    </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

response.name: Create production proposal (Soap 1.1)
response.body: Logon failed

exec: pm.test("Sales order data returned", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200) });

pm.test("Delivery proposal " + jsonResponse.d.results[0].BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentID + " for sales order " + pm.environment.get("SalesOrderID") + " found", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200); });
// Delay and let the system complete the async. integration
pm.test("Item 10: Order fulfilment processing status: Not Started", function () { pm.expect(jsonResponse.d.results.Item[0].OrderFulfilmentProcessingStatusCode).to.eql("1") });
pm.test("Goods issue posted for delivery proposal " + pm.environment.get("OutboundDeliveryRequestID"), function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200) });

pm.test("Item 10: Order fulfilment processing status: " + jsonResponse.d.results.OrderFulfilmentProcessingStatusCodeText, function () { pm.expect(jsonResponse.d.results.OrderFulfilmentProcessingStatusCode).to.eql("2") });
pm.test("Outbound delivery " + jsonResponse.d.results[0].ID + " for sales order " + pm.environment.get("SalesOrderID") + " found", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200); });
pm.test("Outbound delivery " + jsonResponse.d.results.ID + " retrieved", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200) });
pm.test("Outbound delivery " + jsonResponse.d.results.ID + " released", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200) });
pm.test("Invoice request item 1: Not Invoiced", function () { pm.expect(jsonResponse.d.results[0].Item[0].InvoicingStatusCode).to.eql("1") });
// Delay release of customer invoice request and let the system complete the async. integration between sales order and customer invoicing

pm.test("Customer invoice status: Not released", function () { pm.expect(jsonResponse.d.results[0].ReleaseStatusCode).to.eql("1") });

// Delay and let the system complete the async. integration

item.name: Query outbound delivery  from scenario "Sell from Stock with External Payment"

exec: pm.test("Outbound delivery " + jsonResponse.d.results[0].ID + " for sales order " + pm.environment.get("SalesOrderID") + " found", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200); });
pm.test("Outbound delivery " + jsonResponse.d.results.ID + " retrieved", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200) });
pm.test("Customer return notification " + jsonResponse.d.results.ID + " created", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(201) });
pm.test("Customer return notification consistency status: " + jsonResponse.d.results.ConsistencyStatusCodeText, function () { pm.expect(jsonResponse.d.results.ConsistencyStatusCode).to.eql("3") });
// Set inbound delivery notification ID of pattern R-CRN-<SalesOrderID-ItemID>-DateTime
let inboundDeliveryNotifID = pm.environment.get("ECommercePrefix") + "CRN-" + pm.environment.get("SalesOrderID") + "-" + pm.environment.get("SalesOrderItemID") + "-" + todayDateTime;
pm.test("Customer return notification retrieved: " + jsonResponse.d.results[0].ID, function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200) });
pm.test("Confirmed inbound delivery " + jsonResponse.d.results[0].ID + " found", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200) });
// Delay and let the system complete the async. process integrations
pm.test("Confirmed inbound delivery " + jsonResponse.d.results.ID + " returned", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200) });
pm.test("Customer return " + jsonResponse.d.results[0].ID + " found", function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200) });
// Delay and let the system complete the async. process integrations
pm.test("Customer return retrieved: " + jsonResponse.d.results[0].ID, function () { pm.response.to.have.status(200) });
pm.test("Invoice request item 1: Not Invoiced", function () { pm.expect(jsonResponse.d.results[0].Item[0].InvoicingStatusCode).to.eql("1") });
// Delay release of customer invoice request and let the system complete the async. integration between sales order and customer invoicing

item.name: Get customer invoice (key access) and check result
Pre-confirm payments using clearing house statements
Get customer invoice and create clearing house statement file

exec: // Create clearing house statement file from payment items
// Loop payment items and create clearing house statement items
console.log("Item index: " + index + " | Amount: " + paymentAmount + " " + paymentCurrency);
console.log("Payment transaction reference: " + paymentRef + " | Customer name: " + jsonResponse.d.results[index].CustomerInvoice.BuyerParty.BuyerPartyName[0].FormattedName);
// Base64 encode the bank statement file string
// Functions to create Clearing House Statement file
writer.AddItem = function AddItem(paymentRef, paymentAmount, paymentCurrency, paymentExecutionDate) {
// temlate for clearing house statement item
'    <!-- Type code: 350 = Credit Card Payment Confirmation -->\r\n' +
'      <!-- Type code: 23 = Clearing House Payment Order -->\r\n' +
